Meryl Streep Goes Full Miranda Priestly on Karl Lagerfeld Over Oscar Dress Drama 
The devil does not wear Chanel Matt Donnelly | February 25, 2017 @ 6:44 PM Getty Images 
Karl Lagerfeld should know better than to mess with Miranda Priestly. 
Academy Award winner Meryl Streep has issued a blistering statement regarding a dust-up with the Chanel designer — in which he accused the “Florence Foster Jenkins” star of allegedly turning down a couture gown because she would not receive a fee to wear it at Sunday’s Oscar ceremony. 
“In reference to Mr. Lagerfeld’s ‘statement,’ there is no ‘controversy': Karl Lagerfeld, a prominent designer, defamed me, my stylist, and the illustrious designer whose dress I chose to wear, in an important industry publication,” Streep said of the story that appeared in fashion trade Women’s Wear Daily . Also Read: Meryl Streep Goes Full Miranda Priestly on Karl Lagerfeld Over Oscar Dress Drama 
“That publication printed this defamation, unchecked. Subsequently, the story was picked up globally, and continues, globally, to overwhelm my appearance at the Oscars, on the occasion of my record breaking 20th nomination, and to eclipse this honor in the eyes of the media, my colleagues and the audience. I do not take this lightly, and Mr. Lagerfeld’s generic ‘statement’ of regret for this ‘controversy’ was not an apology. He lied, they printed the lie, and I am still waiting.” 
More to come…
